gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Sand and Gravel Resource Potential in Mapped Surficial Material: Indiana, 2003

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: SAND_GRAVEL_RESOURCES_IN is a polygon shapefile that identifies sand and gravel permissive tracts in the surficial unconsolidated deposits of Indiana. Permissive tracts have been defined by the U.S. Geological Survey (Open File Report 95-681, Singer, D.A., 1993, Basic concepts in three-part quantitative assessments of undiscovered mineral resources: Nonrenewable Resources, v. 2, no. 2, p. 69-81) as areas where the geology permits the existence of mineral deposits (mineral resource potential) of a specific type... Noting that the possibility of the occurrence of the specified deposit type (mineral resource) outside the permissive tract should be negligible. This shapefile provides an approximate economic ranking of the sand and gravel resource potential of each mapped surficial unconsolidated deposit. The resource potential of each map unit within the mapped surficial unconsolidated deposits is ranked as a potential, low potential, or not a potential resource. The definitions of these rankings are derived from Gray, H. H., 1973, Properties and uses of geologic materials in Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map Supplementary Chart 1 and Carr, D. D., and Webb, W. M., 1970, Sand and gravel resources of Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 42-D, 31 p. Potential resource indicates that the surficial unconsolidated deposits are likely to contain economic concentrations of sand and gravel, low potential indicates that the surficial unconsolidated deposits may contain economic concentrations of sand and gravel, and not a potential resource indicates that the surficial unconsolidated deposits do not contain economic concentrations of sand and gravel.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The purpose of SAND_GRAVEL_RESOURCES_IN is to provide a digital map layer, suitable for use in a GIS, that shows the mineral resource potential for sand and gravel in Indiana.

These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcGIS 8.3 shapefile format, approximately 3.1 Mb.

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: This shapefile was derived by assigning qualitative permissive tract assessments to each outcrop area in Gray, H. H., 1989, Quaternary geologic map of Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 49. The attribute table data was derived from Gray, H. H., 1973, Properties and uses of geologic materials in Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Regional Geologic Map Supplementary Chart 1 and Carr, D. D., and Webb, W. M., 1970, Sand and gravel resources of Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 42-D, 31 p.

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcInfo polygon topology is present.
This shapefile includes all areas of "potential," "low potential," or "no potential" resources for sand and gravel deposits in Indiana.

The accuracy of the rankings of the resource potential is consistent with the definitions provided in Gray, H. H., 1973, Properties and uses of geologic materials in Indiana, Regional Geologic Map Series Supplimentary Chart No. 1 and Carr, D. D., and Webb, W. M., 1970, Sand and gravel resources of Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 42-D, 31 p.
The accuracy of this shapefile is dependant on the accuracy of the map from which it was derived (Miscellaneous Map 49, Indiana Geological Survey). No quantitative tests were performed.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of the shapefile.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Using existing ESRI ArcView shapefiles of Miscellaneous Map 49, the appropriate mapped surficial materials were grouped together into three groups to form the resource polygons. The mineral resource potential for sand and gravel was then assigned to the appropriate polygons in the attribute table.

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: IGS MM49; RGMS Supplimentary Chart No. 1

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit) and MP (Metadata Parser) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Gray, H. H., 1989, Quaternary Geologic Map of Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey, Miscellaneous Map 49

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Geological Survey, Regional Geologic Map Series Supplimentary Chart No. 1

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Gray, H. H., 1973, Properties and Uses of Geologic Materials in Indiana, Regional Geologic Map Series Supplimentary Chart No. 1, Indiana Geological Survey
Sand and Gravel Resources of Indiana: Indiana Geological Survey Bulletin 42-D

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
